{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents mention that dried blood spot tests in neonates are used for screening for metabolic diseases, such as phenylketonuria, congenital hypothyroidism, sickle cell disorders, and HIV infection. They are also used for neonatal screening of glucose-6 phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency. The documents do not mention the use of dried blood spot tests for determining blood group, total cell count, creatinine, or bilirubin.", "answer_choice": "A"}
